newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft Q3 driven by Office 97 sales.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft Q3 driven by Office 97 sales.

text.p: Microsoft Corp Thursday said third quarter results were driven by strong sales of its Office 97 products.

In a statement, the software giant said it earned $1.04 billion or $0.79 a share in the third quarter ended March 31 up from $562 million or $0.44 a share in the year ago. Revenues rose 45 percent to $3.21 billion.
"Worldwide acceptance of Microsoft Office 97 ignited these outstanding results," said Mike Brown, chief financial officer.

"As corporate and retail customers upgraded to this new product with enthusiasm, we also realized solid gains in the (original equipment manufacturers) channel because of the continued popularity of 32-bit Windows operating systems," Brown said. "And we reaped the benefits of an improved cost model.
"However, incredible results like these are seldom duplicated, and we are mindful of the very tough comparisons we will have in fiscal 1998," Brown added.

"We've sold more than 8 million licenses of Office 97 applications and Office 97 is selling at three times the rate of any previous version," said Richard Fade vice president, Desktop Applications Division.

"Currently, we are investing heavily in a range of new Internet-related products, especially in interactive media, where the business models and sources of profitability are not yet clear," Bob Herbold, chief operating officer.
